items.sentence: I don't think that Tom knows how good a dancer Mary is.
I don't think that Tom knows Mary can play the bassoon.
Do you really think you should be doing that right now?
Tom was the one who told me that you shouldn't do that.
We found an abandoned house and lived there for a week.
Tom didn't seem to notice that Mary was staring at him.
I wasn't surprised that Tom didn't know how to do that.
Can you lower your voice, please? I'm really hung over.
Tom's French is much better now than it was a year ago.
The question facing us is whether we should stay or go.
The question is whether Tom can keep up with us or not.
I began to play clarinet when I was thirteen years old.
Tom spent hours trying to figure out what was going on.
Tom needs to make certain that Mary has what she needs.
I'm now fairly certain that that's not going to happen.
I'm going to try to convince Tom to drive us to Boston.
Tom is disappointed because his soccer team didn't win.
I see no reason why I should support somebody like Tom.
Even the richest man in the world can't buy everything.
Sorry, but can you show me the way to the next village?
